content.description: Start on two small crimps at 7' just to the left of Razorblades of Death. Climb straight up on smaller and smaller crimps.
content.location: west face of middle north boulder in the area. to the left of a small vertical crack.

content.description: SS on so-so holds and make a tough pull to a jug.  Finish on jugs.
content.location: Left side of south face on middle south boulder in the area

content.description: Start on a bad sloper on the left side of a sloping feature.  Climb up and right using a cool sloping pinch to better holds and top out.
content.location: north face of NW boulder in the area

content.description: The stand start to Sloping V.  Start on the rail and climb left side of the sloping "V" feature.
content.location: south of Cracked Glass

content.description: Sit start low on a small left hand sidepull crimp and a very small right hand crimp on the same feature.  Make a very hard pull and toss for the rail. Be careful not to dab on the rock behind you. Follow the left sloping side of the "V" feature and top out on slopes.
content.location: in the UFO cluster of boulders tucked into a small closet area.  south of Cracked Glass on the west side of the boulder.

content.description: SS on a good left facing pinch and climb the sloping arete up and to the right to a good jug. mantle out.
content.location: small boulder right of a tall face (Crystal Crimps). far east side of the area

content.description: Start on a left small crimp and a right on a good left angling hold.  Climb small razorblade crimps to gain the crack. Hit the slopers at the top and mantle.
content.location: West face of middle north boulder in the area.

content.description: Start on two side pulls and make a big move to the sharp jug.  Climb on descent holds to the top.
content.location: right side of NE boulder in the area

content.description: climb the left side of the slab starting on a good jug at the base.
content.location: Nrth face of Southwest most boulder in area

content.description: Climb the right side of slab.
content.location: Right side of North face of Southwest most boulder in the area.

content.description: Start in the middle of the slab and climb up using side pull crimp to the top.
content.location: middle of north face of southwest boulder in the area

content.description: SS on an under cling crimp and a left hand pinch just below a large crack. Make a very powerful pull off the ground and make a few more equally powerful moves over the bulge and into the crack.
content.location: north face of middle north boulder in the area

content.description: Start on a sloper at 5' and climb the tall face with a mix of sloping holds to good jug.  Continue up to the peak and top out.  Look for a big hold over the lip.
content.location: Southeast face of Southwest boulder in the UFO cluster.

content.description: SS on a small right crimp and a left sloping hold. make a couple moves to the crux....good luck topping this one out.
content.location: Right side of south face on middle south boulder in the area

content.description: Start with you left hand on a sloper on the arête. Make a tricky 1st move into the under cling and gain the arête. Climb the arête up and right to the peak and mantle.  Be careful not to fall on the boulder below.
content.location: Southwest arête of Southwest most boulder in the area.

content.description: Start on slopers on the far left of a long sloping lip.  traverse right on bad sloping holds to a mantle on more slopers. be careful of the crux in the middle of the face over the worst part of the fall.
content.location: on east face of NW boulder in the area.

content.description: SS on a right crimp and a sloper on the lip. Make a dynamic move to the sloper above and press out a tough mantle.
content.location: Opposite side of boulder that has Signs of Life on it. Far east boulder in the area.

content.description: Start on opposing side pull crimps at chest height and work your way up to make the big move to the jug. Make another bigger move to good hold at the top.
content.location: tall east face of the far East boulders in the area.

content.description: Stand start where the Cracked Glass crack start to widen and head up.
content.location: South side of NW of three boulders

content.description: An absolutely AMAZING finger crack traversing left and out from under a steep rounded boulder. Sit start with good holds in the crack just left of a small boulder at your back.  Make very powerful moves on finger locks and bad feet till the crack widens and tops out. Top out on good holds.
content.location: Three boulders that are close together are part of the four make up the area.  Cracked Glass in on the SE side of the NW of the three boulders.

content.description: Start on a left side pull crimp in a small crack just left of the arête and a right hand pinch on the other side of the arête. Climb straight up the arête.  Mid way up look for a left crimp on the face around the arête and a crimp rail further up. Go to the lip and mantle.
content.location: Southeast arête of Southwest most boulder in the area

content.description: Start on two high slopers to the right of the crack and climb up and to the right on slopers.
content.location: on the North face of the NE boulder in the area

content.description: A small cluster of boulders near the Beer Bong Boulders and near the Corridor Boulders. Shaded, smaller, rounded, goodish landings.
